meanings.definition: In a truthful or accurate manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke soothly when she confirmed the details of the event.
meanings.sent2: He soothly recounted the events of the day without exaggeration.
meanings.sent3: The parrot mimicked her soothly, repeating every word she said.
meanings.sent4: His compass guided him soothly through the dense forest of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye soothly uncovered the hidden truth.

meanings.sent1: So, soothly, the story she told was stranger than fiction.
meanings.sent2: He soothly believed in the magic of the old, dusty book.
meanings.sent3: The cat soothly purred as if agreeing with the absurd statement.
meanings.sent4: The stars above shone soothly, casting a gentle glow on the earth.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song soothly touched the hearts of all who listened.
